project.teaser: In order to boost the transition to a climate neutral transport sector, VERSAPRINT will bring innovations to the battery system to tackle safety issues, enhance performances as well as decrease cost and environmental impact. The VERSAPRINT technical solutions will be achieved...
project.objective: In order to boost the transition to a climate neutral transport sector, VERSAPRINT will bring innovations to the battery system to tackle safety issues, enhance performances as well as decrease cost and environmental impact. The VERSAPRINT technical solutions will be achieved mainly by 2D/3D printing directly on battery components and will operate from the heart of the battery system (i) providing an efficient cell thermal regulation in order to reduce risk of Thermal Runaway (TR) and increase density and lifetime; (ii) significantly improving the system thermal and safety management thanks to in operando sensoring; (iii) adding thermal and safety-oriented functionalities on busbars; (iv) allowing easy and safe dismantling and re-manufacturing; (v) lowering the casing’s weight, without losing its capability to contain TR and while ensuring good recycling rate; (vi) providing an advanced thermal/fire response; and (vii) controlling the exhaust gases released during a TR by cooling and evacuating them safely. VERSAPRINT will also implement a Decision Tool in order to choose the most optimised configuration for a given end application and will provide a validation at TRL5 (i) at module level with two module prototypes (for automotive and aeronautics) as well as one virtual module prototype (for waterway transport); (ii) at system level through simulation for all these applications. Other applications such as bus, non-road mobile machinery and stationary storage will be explored as well, through simulation. VERSAPRINT aims to reach the cost and performances targeted in Batteries Europe 2030 KPIs, while increasing module density by 5% and significantly improving the battery system fire resistance and safety (no fire outside module during TR). Sustainability will be assessed at all development stages. The multi-disciplinary consortium gathers 3 RTO/academic partners and 7 industrial partners (4 IND and 3 SMEs), and is completed by 12 industrial Advisory Board members.
project.title: Versatile printed solutions for a safe and high-performance battery system
project.keywords: Battery, battery system, versatility, safety, density, lifetime, thermal runaway, thermal management, fire resistance, functionalisation, composites materials, printing, automotive aeronautics

article.title: New printing technology for transport sector battery systems

result.title: Cells specifications for (i) generic design; and (ii) automotive, aeronautics and waterborne specific designs V1
result.description: First version -Identification of main characteristics (capacity, format, chemistry, total number needed, mechanical, thermal and electrical performances needed,…) to specify and purchase the cells for (i) generic design in M3; and (ii) automotive, aeronautics and waterborne specific designs in M6 and specific requirements of novel cells chemestries (in particular Gen4) to be considered for adaptation of battery designs to next cell generations. Related to T2.1 activities, gathering requirements from a broad range of applications (from D5.2, D6.1 and D7.1) and novel chemestries known characteristics, behavior and requirements on system level.

result.title: Dissemination and Exploitation plan including communication activities V2
result.description: Periodic plan of the dissemination and exploitation plan including communication activities. Description of the activities developed and planned (clustering activities, events, publications, website, visual materials etc.), timeline, KPIs, audience reached, materials used and visual proof of the activities. Exploitation plan in order to assess the exploitation potential of the developed technologies in terms of KER.Related to task: 8.1 – 8.5

result.title: Roadmap for standardisation and certification
result.description: Alignment of research activities with relevant standards and certifications. Roadmap for the standardisation and certification of the final scaled-up systems. Related to T8.4 activities.

result.title: Dissemination and Exploitation plan including communication activities V1
result.description: Periodic plan of the dissemination and exploitation plan including communication activities. Description of the activities developed and planned (clustering activities, events, publications, website, visual materials etc.), timeline, KPIs, audience reached, materials used and visual proof of the activities. Exploitation plan in order to assess the exploitation potential of the developed technologies in terms of KER.Related to task: 8.1 – 8.5

result.title: Quality assurance and risk management plan V2
result.description: Revised version - Under the premises of the contractual, financial and administrative management rules described in the GA and CA, description of the methodologies implemented by the coordinator and the rules to be followed by the whole consortium ensuring a smooth and organised development of the project, covering: internal management structure of the consortium and the advisory board; access and structure of the project database (Sharepoint – D1.4); internal communication rules; IPR management rules; procedures and KPI to ensure the quality standards; risk management plan including mitigation measures. Related to tasks: 1.1 – 1.2 – 1.3

result.title: Quality assurance and risk management plan V3
result.description: Final version - Under the premises of the contractual, financial and administrative management rules described in the GA and CA, description of the methodologies implemented by the coordinator and the rules to be followed by the whole consortium ensuring a smooth and organised development of the project, covering: internal management structure of the consortium and the advisory board; access and structure of the project database (Sharepoint – D1.4); internal communication rules; IPR management rules; procedures and KPI to ensure the quality standards; risk management plan including mitigation measures. Related to tasks: 1.1 – 1.2 – 1.3

result.title: Module safety tests and simulation
result.description: Generic module tests and simulation decription - as defined in testing methodology in section 1.2.1.2 - followed by analysis of results to validate the safety of the combination of all BBs at module level : resistance of the module to TR propagation, mechanical performance and fire resistance. Related to T4.5 activities.

result.title: Requirements, use cases and KPIs (automotive applications)
result.description: For automotive end-use applications: technical requirements and use cases for prototyping (main use-case for WP6) and extrapolation studies (D5.4), associated with KPIs. Related to T6.1 activities.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - VERSAPRINT (Versatile printed solutions for a safe and high-performance battery system)
result.teaser: VERSAPRINT brings innovations to the battery system through the development of versatile technical solutions (Building Blocks – BB), achieved mainly by 3D printing. These solutions will collectively contribute to tackling safety issues, enhancing performances and decreasing...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Eco-design and scale-up recommendations at module level
result.description: Assessment of all the involved technology BBs (feasible materials, formulations and processes) to select best trade-offs between performances (technical and economical), dismountability and sustainability at module level. Related to T4.6 activities.

result.title: Requirements, use cases and KPIs (waterborne and other applications)
result.description: For waterborne and other end-use applications: technical requirements and use cases for virtual prototyping (main use-case for D5.3) and extrapolation studies (D5.4), associated with KPIs. Related to T5.2 activities.

result.title: Cells specifications for (i) generic design; and (ii) automotive, aeronautics and waterborne specific designs V2
result.description: Second version - Identification of main characteristics (capacity, format, chemistry, total number needed, mechanical, thermal and electrical performances needed,…) to specify and purchase the cells for (i) generic design in M3; and (ii) automotive, aeronautics and waterborne specific designs in M6 and specific requirements of novel cells chemestries (in particular Gen4) to be considered for adaptation of battery designs to next cell generations. Related to T2.1 activities, gathering requirements from a broad range of applications (from D5.2, D6.1 and D7.1) and novel chemestries known characteristics, behavior and requirements on system level.

result.title: Requirements, use cases and KPIs (aeronautics applications)
result.description: For aeronautics end-use applications: technical requirements and use cases for prototyping (main use-case for WP7) and extrapolation studies (D5.4), associated with KPIs. Related to T7.1 activities.

result.title: Eco-design and scale-up recommendations at cells unit level
result.description: Assessment of all the involved technology BBs at cell units level (feasible materials, formulations and processes) to select best trade-offs between performances (technical and economical), dismountability and sustainability. Related to T3.6 activities.

result.title: Summary of performances validation and safety evaluation at module level (BBs 5,6,7) (public version)
result.description: Summary (for non-confidential publication) of tests and characterisation results to validate the performances of the BBs 5,6,7 at module level. Related to T4.2, T4.3 and T4.4 activities.

result.title: Eco-design and scale-up recommendations at cell level
result.description: Development of an LCA tool. Assessment of all the involved technology BBs (feasible materials, formulations and processes) to select best trade-offs between performance (technical and economical) and sustainability (incl. recyclability potential, manufacturability, scalability) at cell level. Related to T2.5 activities.

result.title: Quality assurance and risk management plan V1
result.description: First version Under the premises of the contractual financial and administrative management rules described in the GA and CA description of the methodologies implemented by the coordinator and the rules to be followed by the whole consortium ensuring a smooth and organised development of the project covering internal management structure of the consortium and the advisory board access and structure of the project database Sharepoint D14 internal communication rules IPR management rules procedures and KPI to ensure the quality standards risk management plan including mitigation measures Related to tasks 11 12 13

category.title: remanufacturing

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
